description:
Data Science Leader

United States * Virtual
Req #480

Wednesday, February 7, 2024

Are you a dreamer, innovator, thinker and a do-er who believes in contributing to something that makes difference?

Pursue your passion. Join PMI.

How You'll Make a Difference

PMI maintains the largest global community of project professionals and seeks frequent forms of engagement with the community members via its 300+ local chapters.

You will be responsible for leading data science strategy and execution. Guiding and mentoring 1-2 data scientists. Responsible for owning and driving end-to-end delivery of machine-learning-based solutions to solve business problems in collaboration with business and technical stakeholders.

Essential Job Functions
• Drive end-to-end delivery of machine-learning models.
• Manage detailed business requirements and technical specifications.
• Own machine-learning model development cycle (identification and definition of business questions, data preparation and manipulation, model implementation and optimization, and deployment).
• Engage closely with business stakeholders to define and refine quantitative problems, translating business challenges into data-driven solutions.
• Design, implement, and optimize machine learning models, transforming data insights into practical and functional tools that drive value and competitive advantage.
• Collaborate with data engineering and quality teams to establish and maintain necessary infrastructure and data sets.
• Establish monitoring systems to track model performance, detect anomalies, and measure model accuracy.
• Continuously optimize models and algorithms to improve performance, scalability, and efficiency.

What You'll Bring to the Role
• Bachelor's degree in a related field.
• Experience with machine learning techniques (regression, decision trees, random forests, support vector machines, neural networks, K-means, Naive Bayes, etc.).
• Understanding of data marketplace technologies, data modeling, and analytics technology stack.
• Familiarity with scalable model deployment practices and technologies, including containerization (e.g., Docker), orchestration (e.g., Kubernetes), cloud platforms, continuous integration, and continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines, monitoring tools, and version control systems.
• Familiarity with monitoring systems implementation to track the performance of deployed models (alerts for model degradation, data drift, etc.)
• Proficiency in programming languages (R, Python, SQL)
• Experience with agile methodologies and technology (ADO, Jira, etc.)
• Proficiency in data extraction, manipulation, transformation, consolidation, querying, analysis, etc.
• Excellent communication, facilitation, and presentation skills, leveraging technical and business languages.
• Strong critical thinking skills and attention to detail
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
• Proficiency in the business language for PMI (English)
• Preferred: Experience with Snowpark

What you can expect from us

We value and nurture an environment of inclusivity and diversity, and a culture of communication and collaboration. Your health, safety and well-being come first, and we believe that you should have time for your work, but you should also have time for you..

Join us and you'll get:
• an excellent total package, with compensation and benefits based upon your geographic location.
• skill development opportunities, to help you grow now and into the future.
• access to a global network, to enrich your professional experience.
• flexible options to help balance work time and your time
• award and bonus opportunities.

The salary offer will be based on several factors, including the candidate's demonstrated skills, qualifications and relevant experience.

Let's help make the world work better for everyone. Apply today!
